meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to give effect in Hong Kong to the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora signed in Washington D.C. on 3 March 1973; to regulate the import, introduction from the sea, export, re-export, and possession or control of certain endangered species of animals and plants and parts and derivatives of those species; and to provide for incidental and connected matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Protection of Endangered Species of Animals and Plants Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Advertisement
def.leadIn: advertisement (廣告), in relation to a specimen of a scheduled species, means any form of advertising that describes, makes reference or alludes in any other way to that scheduled species or specimen—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether directly or indirectly;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether orally, in writing in any language, diagrammatically, pictorially, by the use of symbols or photographs, or in any combination of them; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether or not the common name or the scientific name, or both, of that scheduled species or specimen appears in the advertisement;

subsection.def: Appendices (《附錄》) means Appendix I, Appendix II and Appendix III;
Appendix I (附錄I) means column 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 1;
Appendix I species (附錄I物種) means a species, or a species included in a higher taxon, as specified in Appendix I;
Appendix II (附錄II) means column 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 1;
Appendix II species (附錄II物種) means a species, or a species included in a higher taxon, as specified in Appendix II;
Appendix III (附錄III) means column 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 1;
Appendix III species (附錄III物種) means a species, or a species included in a higher taxon, as specified in Appendix III;
artificially propagated (人工培植) has the meaning assigned to it in Part 1 of Schedule 3;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person holding an office specified in Schedule 1 to the Customs and Excise Service Ordinance (Cap. 342); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public officer authorized by the Director under section 27;

subsection.def: bred in captivity (圈養繁殖) has the meaning assigned to it in Part 1 of Schedule 3;

def.name: CertificateInLieu
def.leadIn: certificate in lieu (代用證明書), in relation to a specimen of a scheduled species brought into Hong Kong from a place outside Hong Kong, means a certificate of captive breeding or of artificial propagation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is issued by a relevant authority of that place in respect of that specimen and remains in force when relied on to show compliance with this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that conforms to the provisions applicable to such a certificate in Part 2 of Schedule 3;

def.name: CommercialPurposes

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a purpose relating to trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a purpose of obtaining profit or other economic benefit (whether in cash or in kind) and directed towards sale, resale, exchange, provision of a service or other form of economic use or benefit, whether direct or indirect,

def.continued: and non-commercial purposes (非商業目的) shall be construed accordingly;

subsection.def: Conference of the Parties (締約國大會) means the Conference of the Parties provided for in the Convention;

Convention (《公約》) means the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora signed in Washington D.C. on 3 March 1973, as amended from time to time and as applied to Hong Kong;

def.name: ConventionCertifyingDocument
def.leadIn: Convention certifying document (《公約》證明文件), in relation to a specimen of a scheduled species brought into Hong Kong from a place outside Hong Kong, means a permit, certificate or other document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is issued by a relevant authority of that place in respect of that specimen and remains in force when relied on to show compliance with this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: Director (署長) means the Director of Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation, the Deputy Director of Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation or an Assistant Director of Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation;
elephant hunting trophy (象狩獵品) has the meaning given by section 1(1) of Schedule 4; (Added 7 of 2018 s. 3)
former licence (前許可證) means a licence within the meaning of section 7 of the repealed Ordinance;
in transit (過境) has the meaning assigned to it in section 3;

def.name: Pre-conventionCertificate
def.leadIn: pre-Convention certificate (《公約》前證明書), in relation to a specimen of a scheduled species, means a certificate—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that conforms to the provisions applicable to such a certificate in Part 2 of Schedule 3;

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any other place, means any person or organization designated as a competent authority by the government of that place for the purposes of registering scientific institutions, or of issuing documentation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is comparable to a document required to be produced or surrendered under this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that conforms substantially to the provisions applicable to that document in Part 2 of Schedule 3;

subsection.def: scheduled species (列明物種) means an Appendix I species, Appendix II species or Appendix III species;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an institution established in Hong Kong, means a scientific institution that is registered in accordance with regulations made by the Secretary under section 53; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an institution established in a place outside Hong Kong, means a scientific institution that is registered by a relevant authority of that place and has been acknowledged by the Secretariat as being so registered;

subsection.def: Secretariat (秘書處) means the Secretariat provided for in the Convention;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Environment and Ecology; (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)
specified form (指明表格) means a form specified under section 51;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any animal or plant, whether live or dead;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an animal of an Appendix I species or Appendix II species, any part or derivative of the animal;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: in the case of a plant of an Appendix I species, any part or derivative of the plant; or

paragraph.name: e

subsection.def: thing (物品) includes any animal and plant, whether live or dead.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a specimen of an Appendix I species shall be treated as a specimen of an Appendix II species if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an animal or any part or derivative of an animal, the animal is bred in captivity for commercial purposes by a captive-breeding operation registered by the Secretariat for breeding animals of an Appendix I species; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a plant or any part or derivative of a plant, the plant is artificially propagated for commercial purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a thing (including a thing contained in any receptacle)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is claimed, represented or held out by any person, whether by advertisement or in any other way, to be or to contain a specimen; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that appears from an accompanying document, packaging, mark or label, or from other circumstances, to be or to contain a specimen,

subsection.continued: shall be treated as such a specimen.

subsection.leadIn: The Appendices shall be construed in accordance with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the interpretation provisions set out in Part 1 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the annotations contained in the Appendices; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the annotations set out at the end of the Appendices.

subsection.content: A note located in the text of this Ordinance is provided for information only and has no legislative effect. (Added 7 of 2018 s. 3)

def.name: InTransit
def.heading: Meaning of in transit
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a thing is in transit if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is brought into Hong Kong from a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is in the process of being taken to another place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it remains under the control of the Director or an authorized officer from the time it is brought into Hong Kong up to the time it is taken outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application to hybrids
section.content: This Ordinance applies to a hybrid animal or hybrid plant in accordance with the provisions applicable to it as set out in Part 1 of Schedule 3.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Restriction on import of specimens of Appendix I species

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 47, a person shall not import a specimen of an Appendix I species—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except as provided in section 17 or 22; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: except under and in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(a) prior to the import; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Convention certifying document issued in respect of that specimen.

subsection.leadIn: A person who imports a specimen of an Appendix I species under and in accordance with the documents referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i) and (ii) shall, upon the landing of that specimen in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce, or cause to be produced, the relevant licence to an authorized officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: surrender, or cause to be surrendered, the relevant Convention certifying document to the authorized officer for retention and cancellation.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $10,000,000 and to imprisonment for 10 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 4)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Restriction on introduction from the sea of specimens of Appendix I species

subsection.content: Subject to section 47, a person shall not introduce from the sea a specimen of an Appendix I species except under and in accordance with a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(b) prior to the introduction from the sea.

A person who introduces from the sea a specimen of an Appendix I species under and in accordance with the licence referred to in subsection (1) shall, upon the landing of that specimen in Hong Kong, produce, or cause to be produced, that licence to an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $10,000,000 and to imprisonment for 10 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 5)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Restriction on export of specimens of Appendix I species

subsection.content: Subject to section 47, a person shall not export a specimen of an Appendix I species except under and in accordance with a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(c) prior to the export.

A person who exports a specimen of an Appendix I species under and in accordance with the licence referred to in subsection (1) shall, before the removal of that specimen from Hong Kong, produce, or cause to be produced, that licence to an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $10,000,000 and to imprisonment for 10 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 6)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Restriction on re-export of specimens of Appendix I species

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 47, a person shall not re-export a specimen of an Appendix I species—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except as provided in section 22; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except under and in accordance with a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(d) prior to the re-export.

subsection.content: A person who re-exports a specimen of an Appendix I species under and in accordance with the licence referred to in subsection (1)(b) shall, before the removal of that specimen from Hong Kong, produce, or cause to be produced, that licence to an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $10,000,000 and to imprisonment for 10 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 7)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Restriction on possession or control of specimens of Appendix I species

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 47, a person shall not have in his possession or under his control a specimen of an Appendix I species—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except as provided in section 20 or 22; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except under and in accordance with a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(e).

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $10,000,000 and to imprisonment for 10 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 8)

part.name: P3
part.heading: Regulation of Appendix II Species and Appendix III Species

section.name: s11
section.heading: Restriction on import of specimens of Appendix II species and Appendix III species

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 47, a person shall not import a specimen of an Appendix II species or Appendix III species—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except as provided in section 17, 18, 19 or 22; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: except under and in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(a) prior to the import; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Convention certifying document or certificate in lieu issued in respect of that specimen.

subsection.leadIn: A person who imports a specimen of an Appendix II species or Appendix III species under and in accordance with the documents referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i) and (ii) shall, upon the landing of that specimen in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce, or cause to be produced, the relevant licence to an authorized officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: surrender, or cause to be surrendered, the relevant Convention certifying document or certificate in lieu to the authorized officer for retention and cancellation.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 10)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Restriction on introduction from the sea of specimens of Appendix II species

subsection.content: Subject to section 47, a person shall not introduce from the sea a specimen of an Appendix II species except under and in accordance with a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(b) prior to the introduction from the sea.

A person who introduces from the sea a specimen of an Appendix II species under and in accordance with the licence referred to in subsection (1) shall, upon the landing of that specimen in Hong Kong, produce, or cause to be produced, that licence to an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 11)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Restriction on export of specimens of Appendix II species and Appendix III species

subsection.content: Subject to section 47, a person shall not export a specimen of an Appendix II species or Appendix III species except under and in accordance with a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(c) prior to the export.

A person who exports a specimen of an Appendix II species or Appendix III species under and in accordance with the licence referred to in subsection (1) shall, before the removal of that specimen from Hong Kong, produce, or cause to be produced, that licence to an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 12)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Restriction on re-export of specimens of Appendix II species and Appendix III species

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 47, a person shall not re-export a specimen of an Appendix II species or Appendix III species—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except as provided in section 22; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except under and in accordance with a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(d) prior to the re-export.

subsection.content: A person who re-exports a specimen of an Appendix II species or Appendix III species under and in accordance with the licence referred to in subsection (1)(b) shall, before the removal of that specimen from Hong Kong, produce, or cause to be produced, that licence to an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 13)

section.name: s15
section.heading: Restriction on possession or control of specimens of Appendix II species

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 47, a person shall not have in his possession or under his control a specimen of an Appendix II species—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except as provided in section 20, 21 or 22; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except under and in accordance with a licence issued in respect of that specimen under section 23(1)(e).

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 14)

part.name: P4
part.heading: Circumstances in which Dealings in Scheduled Species without Licence are Permitted

section.name: s17
section.heading: Import of pre-Convention specimens
section.leadIn: A person may import a specimen of a scheduled species if, upon the landing of the specimen in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he produces, or causes to be produced, to an authorized officer a pre-Convention certificate, or a Convention certifying document containing the particulars required to be specified in a pre-Convention certificate, in respect of the specimen;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized officer has inspected the specimen to compare it with the particulars on that pre-Convention certificate or Convention certifying document and is satisfied that the particulars tally; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where a Convention certifying document is produced under paragraph (a), that person surrenders, or causes to be surrendered, to the authorized officer that document for retention and cancellation.

statutoryNote.content: For a specimen that is an elephant hunting trophy or elephant ivory, see section 2 of Schedule 4, which disapplies this section. (Added 7 of 2018 s. 16. Amended 7 of 2018 s. 16)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Import of specimens of Appendix II species
section.leadIn: A person may import a specimen of an Appendix II species if, upon the landing of the specimen in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he produces, or causes to be produced, to an authorized officer a Convention certifying document or certificate in lieu in respect of the specimen, showing that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the specimen is not a live animal or plant of wild origin, nor is it a live animal or plant that shall be treated as a specimen of an Appendix II species under section 2(2); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the species is not of a population included in Appendix I if the species is specified in both Appendix I and Appendix II;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized officer has inspected the specimen to compare it with the particulars on that Convention certifying document or certificate in lieu and is satisfied that the particulars tally; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that person surrenders, or causes to be surrendered, to the authorized officer that Convention certifying document or certificate in lieu for retention and cancellation.

statutoryNote.content: For a specimen that is an elephant hunting trophy or elephant ivory, see section 3 of Schedule 4, which disapplies this section. (Added 7 of 2018 s. 17)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Import of specimens of Appendix III species

subsection.leadIn: A person may import a specimen of an Appendix III species if, upon the landing of the specimen in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he produces, or causes to be produced, to an authorized officer—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the import is from a place specified in parentheses placed against the species in Appendix III, a Convention certifying document or certificate in lieu in respect of the specimen;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the import is from a place that is not so specified in Appendix III and the specimen originates from such a place, a certificate of origin in respect of the specimen; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: in any other case, a certificate—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that is issued in respect of the specimen by a relevant authority of the place from which the specimen is imported and remains in force when relied on to show compliance with this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that shows that the specimen was processed in that place, or has previously been taken into that place from another place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized officer has inspected the specimen to compare it with the particulars on that Convention certifying document, certificate in lieu, certificate of origin, or the certificate referred to in paragraph (a)(iii), as the case may be, and is satisfied that the particulars tally; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that person surrenders, or causes to be surrendered, to the authorized officer the document referred to in paragraph (b) for retention and cancellation.

def.name: CertificateOfOrigin
def.leadIn: In this section, certificate of origin (產地來源證明書), in relation to a specimen originating from a place outside Hong Kong, means a certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is issued by a relevant authority of that place in respect of that specimen and remains in force when relied on to show compliance with this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that conforms to the provisions applicable to such a certificate in Part 2 of Schedule 3.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Possession or control of pre-Convention specimens
section.leadIn: A person may have in his possession or under his control a specimen of an Appendix I species or Appendix II species if he proves the following to the satisfaction of the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that he possesses a pre-Convention certificate in respect of the specimen;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the specimen was imported, or introduced from the sea, before 6 August 1976; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the specimen was imported, or introduced from the sea, on or after that date, the import or introduction from the sea was not in contravention of any provision of the repealed Ordinance or this Ordinance, whichever was in force at that time.

statutoryNote.content: For a specimen that is elephant ivory, see section 9A of Schedule 4, which limits the application of this section to antique elephant ivory only. (Added 7 of 2018 s. 18)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Possession or control of specimens of Appendix II species

subsection.leadIn: A person may have in his possession or under his control a specimen of an Appendix II species if he proves the following to the satisfaction of the Director by documentary evidence or otherwise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the specimen is not a live animal or plant of wild origin, nor is it a live animal or plant that shall be treated as a specimen of an Appendix II species under section 2(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the species is not of a population included in Appendix I if the species is specified in both Appendix I and Appendix II.

subsection.def: In subsection (1), documentary evidence (文件證據) includes but is not limited to a former licence, a certificate in lieu or other Convention certifying document.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Import, re-export and possession or control of specimens in transit

subsection.content: A person may import, re-export or have in his possession or under his control a specimen of a scheduled species (other than a live animal) in transit if, upon the landing of the specimen in Hong Kong, he produces, or causes to be produced, to an authorized officer a Convention certifying document or certificate in lieu in respect of the specimen.

subsection.leadIn: A person may import, re-export or have in his possession or under his control a live animal of a scheduled species in transit if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the landing of the animal in Hong Kong, he produces, or causes to be produced, to an authorized officer a Convention certifying document or certificate in lieu in respect of the animal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), at least 3 working days before the intended date on which the animal is to be brought into Hong Kong, the Director receives a notification made to him in writing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: providing a description and the particulars of the animal;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: stating the intended date on which the animal is to be brought into Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the animal is to be brought into Hong Kong by a vessel, vehicle, train or aircraft, providing particulars of the vessel, vehicle, train or aircraft so as to enable the Director to locate it immediately upon its arrival in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify a number of working days in substitution for the number of working days referred to in subsection (2)(b) in respect of a scheduled species, either generally or for any purposes or by reference to any special circumstances.

subsection.def: In this section, working day (工作天) means any day other than a public holiday or a black rainstorm warning day or gale warning day within the meaning of section 71 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s23
section.heading: Issue of licences

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, on application made to him in the specified form and on payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 2, issue a licence for the—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: import;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: introduction from the sea;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: export;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: re-export; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: possession or control,

subsection.continued: of a specimen of a scheduled species.

subsection.content: The Director shall not approve an application made under this section if such approval would contravene any requirement under the Convention.
On issuing any such licence, the Director may impose such conditions as he considers appropriate, including conditions that are more stringent than any requirement under the Convention.

subsection.leadIn: A licence issued under this section shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the name and address of the holder of the licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the quantity and description of the specimen concerned;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: specify the conditions, if any, of the licence; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: specify the period of validity of the licence.

subsection.content: If any condition of a licence issued under this section is contravened, the holder of the licence commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

statutoryNote.content: For a licence in respect of a specimen that is an elephant hunting trophy or elephant ivory, see sections 4, 6 and 10 of Schedule 4, which restrict the Director’s power to approve an application under this section. (Added 7 of 2018 s. 19)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Extension, renewal and variation of licences

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, on application made to him in the specified form and on payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 2—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: extend the period of validity of a licence issued under section 23(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: renew a licence issued under section 23(1)(e); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: vary a licence issued under section 23 in any other way.

subsection.content: The Director shall not approve an application made under this section if such approval would contravene any requirement under the Convention.

statutoryNote.content: For a licence in respect of a specimen that is an elephant hunting trophy or elephant ivory, see sections 4, 6 and 10 of Schedule 4, which restrict the Director’s power to approve an application under this section. (Added 7 of 2018 s. 20)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Refusal of application made under section 23 or 24
section.content: If the Director refuses an application made under section 23 or 24, he shall give written notice of the refusal to the applicant stating the reason for the refusal.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Cancellation of licences

subsection.leadIn: The Director may cancel a licence that is issued under section 23 or extended, renewed or varied under section 24 if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any condition of the licence is contravened; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the licence was issued, extended, renewed or varied as a result of a false representation of any fact made by the applicant or an unlawful act of the applicant.

subsection.content: If the Director cancels a licence under subsection (1), he shall give written notice of the cancellation to the holder of the licence stating the reason for the cancellation.
After receipt of a notice of cancellation under subsection (2), the holder of the relevant licence shall immediately surrender the licence to the Director.

If that holder lodges an appeal under section 46(1) against the Director’s decision relating to the cancellation of the relevant licence, the Director shall return the licence to that holder pending the determination of the appeal by the Administrative Appeals Board.

If the Administrative Appeals Board confirms the Director’s decision relating to the cancellation of the relevant licence, that holder shall, immediately after receipt of a notice of the Administrative Appeals Board’s decision, surrender the licence to the Director.
A holder of a licence who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (3) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

part.name: P5A
part.heading: Special Provisions for Elephant Hunting Trophies and Elephant Ivory

section.name: s26A
section.heading: Specified provisions subject to Schedule 4

subsection.content: A specified provision applies subject to Schedule 4 in relation to a specimen that is an elephant hunting trophy or elephant ivory.

For the purpose of providing information on any provision in Schedule 4 that relates to a specified provision, the Secretary may, by order published in the Gazette, amend the specified provision by adding or amending a note.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedProvision
def.leadIn: specified provision (指明條文) means any of the following provisions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 23;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 24;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Protection of Endangered Species of Animals and Plants (Exemption for Appendix I Species) Order (Cap. 586 sub. leg. A);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Protection of Endangered Species of Animals and Plants (Exemption for Appendices II and III Species) Order (Cap. 586 sub. leg. B).

section.name: s27
section.heading: Authorized officers

subsection.content: The Director may in writing authorize any public officer to exercise any of the powers and perform any of the duties conferred or imposed on the Director or an authorized officer by this Ordinance.
The Director may exercise any of the powers or perform any of the duties conferred or imposed on an authorized officer by this Ordinance.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Power to require production of document or other evidence to show compliance with this Ordinance

subsection.content: If a person has in his possession or under his control a specimen of a scheduled species, an authorized officer may require the person to produce any document or other evidence on which the person relies to show that the possession or control is not in contravention of this Ordinance.
A person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Power to require scientific names and common names

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that an animal or plant, whether live or dead, or a part of an animal or plant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is being or has been imported;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is being or has been introduced from the sea;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is in transit;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is being or is to be exported; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is being or is to be re-exported,

subsection.continued: and is a specimen of a scheduled species, he may require the person who has the animal, plant or part in his possession or under his control to give its scientific name and common name.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly makes a false statement in purported compliance with such a requirement,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Power to require production of things for inspection
section.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is being or has been imported;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is being or has been introduced from the sea;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is in transit;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is being or is to be exported;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is being or is to be re-exported; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is in the possession or under the control of any person,

section.continued: and is a specimen of a scheduled species, that officer may, for the purposes of verifying compliance with this Ordinance and on production of written evidence of his identity, stop the person who has the thing in his possession or under his control and require him to produce the thing for inspection.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Power to inspect place or premises

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a specimen of a scheduled species is being kept for commercial purposes in any place or premises, he may, for the purposes of verifying compliance with this Ordinance, without notice and on production of written evidence of his identity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter and inspect the place or premises during reasonable hours;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inspect the thing suspected to be a specimen of a scheduled species; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the production of, inspect, examine or take copies of any document that is related to compliance with this Ordinance and is in the place or premises.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer shall not under subsection (1) enter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any premises that are used exclusively as a dwelling-house; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any part of any premises that is used exclusively as a dwelling-house.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Power of search and detention

subsection.content: An authorized officer may, on production of written evidence of his identity, stop, board and search any vessel, vehicle, train or aircraft (other than a ship of war, military aircraft or military vehicle) if he reasonably suspects that an offence under Part 2 or 3 has been, is being or is about to be committed in or on the vessel, vehicle, train or aircraft.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under Part 2 or 3, that officer may, on production of written evidence of his identity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stop and search the person, and search the property of the person, for anything that is likely to be of value (whether by itself or together with anything else) to the investigation of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: detain the person for a reasonable period while that officer inquires about the suspected commission of the offence.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Power of entry into place or premises

subsection.content: If it is shown to the satisfaction of a magistrate on information on oath that there is in any place or premises any thing liable to seizure, or any thing likely to be or to contain evidence of an offence under Part 2 or 3, the magistrate may by warrant authorize any authorized officer to enter, by force if necessary, and search the place or premises.

An authorized officer entering any place or premises under subsection (1) may take with him such persons as may be necessary, and on leaving any unoccupied place or premises that he has entered shall leave the place or premises as effectually secured against trespassers as he found them to be at the time of entry.
A warrant issued under subsection (1) continues in force until the purpose for which the entry is necessary has been satisfied.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Power of seizure

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may seize, remove and detain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a thing liable to seizure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a receptacle in which a seized thing is contained or a handling device or other device used for or in connection with the thing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any food or drink accompanying a seized animal; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any thing that appears to that officer to be or to contain evidence that an offence under Part 2 or 3 has been committed.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a thing is liable to seizure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if an authorized officer reasonably suspects that the thing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is being or has been imported;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is being or has been introduced from the sea;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is being or is to be exported;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: is being or is to be re-exported; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: is in the possession or under the control of any person,

paragraph.continued: in contravention of any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the thing is an animal or plant, whether live or dead, or a part of an animal or plant in respect of which a person has failed to comply with a requirement made under section 29(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if it is a thing in respect of which a person has failed to comply with a requirement made under section 30; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if it is a thing in respect of which an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has contravened section 44.

subsection.content: No civil liability shall be incurred by an authorized officer in respect of anything done or omitted to be done by that officer in good faith in the exercise or purported exercise of any power under this section.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Disposal of seized things

subsection.leadIn: The Director may cause the following things seized under section 34(1) to be released, sold, or disposed of in any other way, immediately after the seizure—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is impracticable for any reason for the Director to keep in captivity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that is likely to die or be subjected to unnecessary suffering if it is kept in captivity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any live plant that is impracticable for any reason for the Director to detain;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any thing that is perishable.

subsection.content: Subject to Part 7, the proceeds of sale of any thing sold under subsection (1) shall be paid into the general revenue.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Power to require identification

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under this Ordinance, he may, without warrant and on production of written evidence of his identity, stop the person or, where the person is in or on a vessel, vehicle, train or aircraft (other than a ship of war, military aircraft or military vehicle), stop and board the vessel, vehicle, train or aircraft, as the case may be, for the purposes of requiring that person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to state his name and address; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce his proof of identity for inspection.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly gives a false or misleading name or address in purported compliance with such a requirement, (Amended 7 of 2018 s. 22)

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

subsection.def: In this section, proof of identity (身分證明文件) means proof of identity within the meaning of section 17B of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115).

section.name: s37
section.heading: Power of arrest

subsection.content: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has committed, is committing or is about to commit an offence under Part 2 or 3 or section 38, he may arrest the person without warrant.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has committed, is committing or is about to commit any other offence under this Ordinance, he may arrest the person without warrant only in circumstances where it appears to the authorized officer that service of a summons is impracticable because—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person is unknown to, and cannot be readily ascertained by, that officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that officer has reasonable grounds for doubting whether a name given by the person as his name, when required to do so under section 36, is his real name;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has failed to give a satisfactory address for service, when required to do so under section 36; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that officer has reasonable grounds for doubting whether an address given by the person, when required to do so under section 36, is a satisfactory address for service.

subsection.content: If any person who is liable to be arrested under this section forcibly resists the endeavour to arrest him, or attempts to evade the arrest, an authorized officer may use all reasonable means necessary to effect the arrest.

If an authorized officer arrests a person under this section, he shall immediately take the person to the nearest police station or hand him over to the custody of a police officer to be dealt with in accordance with the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232).

section.name: s38
section.heading: Obstruction
section.content: A person who without reasonable excuse obstructs an authorized officer exercising any power under section 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 36 or 37 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 7
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: proceeds of sale (售賣得益), in relation to a thing seized under section 34(1), means the proceeds of sale of that thing if already sold under section 35;
thing seized under section 34(1) (根據第34(1)條檢取的物品) means a thing seized under section 34(1)(a) and includes any other thing seized under section 34(1)(b), (c) or (d) in connection with that thing.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Return or forfeiture of things seized in respect of offences charged under Part 2 or 3

subsection.leadIn: If a person is convicted of an offence under Part 2 or 3, the court or magistrate may order any thing seized under section 34(1) in connection with the offence that is not a specimen of a scheduled species, or any proceeds of sale of that thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be returned to the person from whom it was seized or to its owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be forfeited to the Government.

subsection.content: If a person is convicted of an offence under Part 2 or 3, any specimen of a scheduled species seized under section 34(1) in connection with the offence, or any proceeds of sale of the specimen if already sold under section 35, shall, without order, be forfeited to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: If an offence is prosecuted under Part 2 or 3 and no defendant in the proceedings is convicted of the offence, the court or magistrate may order any thing seized under section 34(1) in respect of which the prosecution was brought, or any proceeds of sale of that thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be returned to the person from whom it was seized or to its owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be forfeited to the Government.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Return or forfeiture of things seized on prosecution of offences under section 29 or 44
section.leadIn: If an offence is prosecuted under section 29 or 44, the court or magistrate may, whether or not any defendant in the proceedings is convicted of the offence, order any thing seized under section 34(1) in respect of which the prosecution was brought, or any proceeds of sale of that thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be returned to the person from whom it was seized or to its owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be forfeited to the Government.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Return or forfeiture of things seized where no prosecution for offences

subsection.content: If a thing has been seized under section 34(1) but no prosecution for an offence under Part 2 or 3 or section 29 or 44 has been brought in respect of that thing, an authorized officer may apply to the court or magistrate for an order in respect of that thing or any proceeds of sale of that thing.

subsection.leadIn: On an application under subsection (1), the court or magistrate may order the thing concerned or any proceeds of sale of that thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be returned to the person from whom it was seized or to its owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be forfeited to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: If a thing seized under section 34(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is placed in the possession or under the control of the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is abandoned by its owner, or appears to the Director to have been so abandoned,

subsection.continued: an authorized officer may apply to the court or magistrate for an order in respect of that thing.

subsection.content: On an application under subsection (3), the court or magistrate may, if satisfied that the owner of the thing concerned is unknown or cannot be found, order that thing to be forfeited to the Government.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Disposal of forfeited things, etc.

subsection.content: The Director may sell, or dispose of in any other way, any thing that is seized under section 34(1) and forfeited to the Government under this Part in such manner as he thinks fit.
The proceeds of sale of any thing sold under subsection (1) shall be paid into the general revenue.

Any person who considers himself aggrieved by the sale or disposal of any thing that was ordered to be forfeited to the Government under section 42(4) may complain to the court or magistrate within 6 months of the sale or disposal.

On a complaint under subsection (3), the court or magistrate may, if satisfied as to the title of the complainant to the thing concerned, order that such sum by way of compensation be paid to the complainant as it may consider just.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Furnishing false information

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he, on an application made under section 23 or 24 or in purported compliance with this Ordinance, furnishes any information that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he knows or believes to be misleading in any material particular.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if he claims, represents or holds out, whether by advertisement or in any other way, that a thing is a specimen of a scheduled species, without any belief in the truth of the claim, representation or holding out.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Protection of informers

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no information on the identity of an informer relating to an offence under this Ordinance shall be admitted in evidence in any civil or criminal proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a witness in any civil or criminal proceedings is not obliged or permitted—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to disclose the name or address of any informer who has given information to the Director, any authorized officer or the police with respect to an offence under this Ordinance, or the name or address of any person who has assisted the Director, any authorized officer or the police in any way with respect to such an offence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to answer any question if the answer would lead, or would tend to lead, to discovery of the name or address of such informer or person,

paragraph.continued: if, in either case, the informer or the person is not himself a witness in such proceedings.

subsection.content: If any books, documents or papers that are in evidence or liable to inspection in any civil or criminal proceedings contain an entry in which an informer or person referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i) is named or described or that might lead to his discovery, the court or magistrate shall cause all such passages to be concealed from view or to be obliterated so far as may be necessary to protect the informer or the person, as the case may be, from discovery.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance the court or magistrate, after full inquiry into the case, is satisfied that an informer made a material statement that the informer knew or believed to be false or did not believe to be true; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other proceedings the court or magistrate is of opinion that justice cannot be fully done between the parties concerned without disclosure of the name of an informer or of a person who has assisted the Director, any authorized officer or the police,

subsection.continued: the court or magistrate may require the production of the original information and permit inquiry and require full disclosure concerning the informer or the person.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Appeals to Administrative Appeals Board

subsection.leadIn: A person aggrieved by a decision of the Director relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the refusal to issue a licence under section 23;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application to extend or renew a licence under section 24;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application to vary a licence under section 24;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any condition specified in a licence issued under section 23 or extended, renewed or varied under section 24; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the cancellation of a licence under section 26,

subsection.continued: may, within 21 days of receiving notice of the decision, appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board against the decision.

subsection.content: Where the appeal is against a decision relating to a matter mentioned in subsection (1)(b), the licence concerned shall, despite the expiry of its period of validity, be treated as continuing in force subject to its conditions until the determination of the appeal by the Administrative Appeals Board.

Where the appeal is against a decision relating to a matter mentioned in subsection (1)(c), the licence concerned shall not be varied pending the determination of the appeal by the Administrative Appeals Board.

Where the appeal is against a decision relating to a matter mentioned in subsection (1)(d) or (e), the decision shall not become effective pending the determination of the appeal by the Administrative Appeals Board.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Exemption orders

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of enabling any part of the Convention, or of a Convention instrument, relating to an exemption in respect of the import, introduction from the sea, export or re-export of any Appendix I species to have the force of law in Hong Kong, the Chief Executive in Council may, by order published in the Gazette, exempt from the application of section 5, 6, 7 or 8, either generally or for any purposes or by reference to any circumstances, and either conditionally or unconditionally—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person or any group or description of persons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any specimen of any Appendix I species, or of any group or description of such species.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of enabling any part of the Convention, or of a Convention instrument, relating to an exemption in respect of the import, introduction from the sea, export or re-export of any Appendix II species or Appendix III species to have the force of law in Hong Kong, the Secretary may, by order published in the Gazette, exempt from the application of section 11, 12, 13 or 14, as the case may be, either generally or for any purposes or by reference to any circumstances, and either conditionally or unconditionally—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person or any group or description of persons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any specimen of any Appendix II species or Appendix III species, or of any group or description of such species.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, in relation to the possession or control of any Appendix I species, by order published in the Gazette, exempt from the application of section 9, either generally or for any purposes or by reference to any circumstances, or in any particular case, and either conditionally or unconditionally—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person or any group or description of persons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any specimen of any Appendix I species, or of any group or description of such species.

subsection.leadIn: Without contravening any requirement under the Convention, the Secretary may, in relation to the import of any live specimen of Appendix II species, by order published in the Gazette, exempt from the application of section 11, either generally or for any purposes or by reference to any circumstances, or in any particular case, and either conditionally or unconditionally—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person or any group or description of persons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any specimen of any Appendix II species, or of any group or description of such species.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, in relation to the possession or control of any Appendix II species, by order published in the Gazette, exempt from the application of section 15, either generally or for any purposes or by reference to any circumstances, or in any particular case, and either conditionally or unconditionally—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person or any group or description of persons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any specimen of any Appendix II species, or of any group or description of such species.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Power to amend Schedules

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by order published in the Gazette, amend any Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If, at the commencement of an order amending Schedule 1—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has in his possession or under his control a specimen of an Appendix I species or Appendix II species; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 9(1) or 15(1) does not apply to the specimen prior to that commencement,

subsection.continued: section 9(1) or 15(1), as the case may be, shall apply in respect of the specimen only on the expiry of 3 months after that commencement unless otherwise stated in the order.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Advisory Committee

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may establish an Advisory Committee consisting of such members as he may appoint.
The Advisory Committee shall advise the Director upon any question that he may refer to it in connection with the administration of this Ordinance.
The Advisory Committee established under section 14 of the repealed Ordinance shall be treated as the Advisory Committee established under this section.

A person who was, immediately before the commencement* of this section, a member of the Advisory Committee established under section 14 of the repealed Ordinance shall be treated as a member of the Advisory Committee established under this section on the same terms and conditions as applied to the person immediately before that commencement.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Director and authorized officers to be subject to Chief Executive’s directions

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may give such directions as he thinks fit, either generally or in any particular case, with respect to the exercise or performance by the Director or an authorized officer of any powers or duties under this Ordinance.

The Director and every authorized officer shall, in the exercise or performance of any powers or duties under this Ordinance, comply with any directions given by the Chief Executive under subsection (1).

section.name: s51
section.heading: Director empowered to specify forms
section.content: The Director may specify any form to be used for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Issue of re-export certificates
section.content: The Director may, on application made to him in the specified form and on payment of the fee prescribed in Schedule 2, issue a re-export certificate in respect of an animal or plant, or any part or derivative of an animal or plant for the purpose of facilitating the applicant’s compliance with a requirement imposed in relation to the Convention by any Party.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Power of Secretary to make regulations
section.leadIn: The Secretary may by regulation provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration of any scientific institution for the purposes of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any matter so as to enable any part of a Convention instrument to have the force of law in Hong Kong with or without modification; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any matter ancillary or incidental to those specified in paragraphs (a) and (b).

section.name: s54
section.heading: Repeal of Animals and Plants (Protection of Endangered Species) Ordinance
section.content: The Animals and Plants (Protection of Endangered Species) Ordinance (Cap. 187) and the Animals and Plants (Protection of Endangered Species) (Exemption) Order (Cap. 187 sub. leg. A) are repealed.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Animals and Plants (Protection of Endangered Species) Ordinance

subsection.def: In this section, relevant date (有關日期) means the date of commencement* of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the relevant date, there was a pending application for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a former licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an extension, a renewal or a variation of a former licence,

subsection.continued: the application shall be treated as an application for a licence made under section 23(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: A former licence that is in force immediately before the relevant date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be treated as a licence issued under section 23(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 26, continues in force until the expiration of the period of validity specified in the licence.

subsection.content: A right of appeal subsisting under section 17 of the repealed Ordinance immediately before the relevant date shall be treated as a right of appeal against a decision to the Administrative Appeals Board under section 46(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), as the case may be.

An appeal pending under section 17 of the repealed Ordinance immediately before the relevant date shall be treated and disposed of as if it were an appeal against a decision pending to the Administrative Appeals Board under section 46(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: there was no licensing requirement in respect of that specimen under section 6 of the repealed Ordinance in force immediately before the relevant date,

subsection.continued: section 9(1) or 15(1), as the case may be, shall apply in respect of that specimen only on the expiry of 6 months after the relevant date.

section.name: s55A
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Protection of Endangered Species of Animals and Plants (Amendment) Ordinance 2018

subsection.content: This section applies in place of section 101J of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221).

If a person commits an offence under section 5, 6, 7, 8 or 9 before the amendment date and is convicted of the offence on or after that date, the person is liable to the penalties under Part 2 as in force immediately before that date.

If a person commits an offence under section 11, 12, 13, 14 or 15 before the amendment date and is convicted of the offence on or after that date, the person is liable to the penalties under Part 3 as in force immediately before that date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: amendment date (修訂日期) means the date on which Parts 2 and 3 are amended by the Protection of Endangered Species of Animals and Plants (Amendment) Ordinance 2018 (7 of 2018).

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Species included in the Appendices are referred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the name of the species; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as being all of the species included in a higher taxon or designated part in that taxon.

section.name: s2
section.content: The abbreviation “spp.” is used to denote all species of a higher taxon.

section.name: s3
section.content: Other references to taxa higher than species are for the purposes of information or classification only. Common names in English, if known, are included within angle brackets (< >) after scientific names in the English text of this Ordinance. Common names in Chinese or Chinese translations of scientific names, if known, are included within angle brackets (< >) after scientific names in the Chinese text of this Ordinance. The common names included after the scientific names of orders, families and genera are intended to indicate the species within the order, family or genus concerned that are included in the Appendices.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: The following abbreviations are used for plant taxa below the level of species—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “ssp.” is used to denote subspecies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “var(s).” is used to denote variety (varieties).

section.name: s5
section.content: As none of the species or higher taxa of FLORA included in Appendix I is annotated to the effect that its hybrids shall be treated in accordance with the provisions of Article III of the Convention, this means that artificially propagated hybrids produced from one or more of these species or taxa may be traded with a certificate of artificial propagation, and that seeds and pollen (including pollinia), cut flowers, seedling or tissue cultures obtained in vitro and transported in sterile containers of these hybrids are not subject to the provisions of this Ordinance. (Amended L.N. 125 of 2023)

section.name: s6
section.content: The names of the places in parentheses placed against the names of species in Appendix III are those of the Parties submitting these species for inclusion in that Appendix.

section.name: s7
section.content: When a species is included in one of the Appendices, any whole animal or plant of the species, whether live or dead, is included. In addition, all parts and derivatives of the species are also included in the same Appendix, except for an animal species listed in Appendix III, or a plant species listed in Appendix II or Appendix III, that is annotated with the symbol (#) followed by a number to indicate that only specific parts and derivatives are included. Such a combination of symbol and number placed against the name of an Appendix II species or Appendix III species designates parts or derivatives that are specified in relation to that species for the purposes of this Ordinance as follows— (Amended L.N. 22 of 2021; L.N. 125 of 2023)

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: Designates all parts and derivatives, except—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: seeds, spores and pollen (including pollinia);

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: seedling or tissue cultures obtained in vitro and transported in sterile containers; (Amended L.N. 125 of 2023)

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: cut flowers of artificially propagated plants; and

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: fruits, parts of fruits, and derivatives of fruits, of artificially propagated plants of the genus Vanilla.

section.name: s0-1
section.leadIn: Designates all parts and derivatives, except—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: seeds and pollen; and

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: finished products packaged and ready for retail trade.

section.name: s0-2
section.content: Designates whole and sliced roots and parts of roots excluding manufactured parts or derivatives such as powders, pills, extracts, tonics, teas and confectionery. (Amended L.N. 98 of 2014)

section.name: s0-3
section.leadIn: Designates all parts and derivatives, except—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: seeds (including seedpods of Orchidaceae), spores and pollen (including pollinia). The exemption does not apply to seeds from Cactaceae spp. exported from Mexico, and to seeds from Beccariophoenix madagascariensis and Dypsis decaryi exported from Madagascar; (Replaced L.N. 36 of 2011. Amended L.N. 114 of 2018)

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: seedling or tissue cultures obtained in vitro and transported in sterile containers; (Amended L.N. 36 of 2011; L.N. 98 of 2014; L.N. 125 of 2023)

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: cut flowers of artificially propagated plants;

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: fruits, parts of fruits, and derivatives of fruits, of naturalized or artificially propagated plants of the genus Vanilla (Orchidaceae) and of the family Cactaceae; (Amended L.N. 36 of 2011)

subsection.name: e
subsection.content: stems, flowers, and parts and derivatives of them, of naturalized or artificially propagated plants of the genera Opuntia subgenus Opuntia and Selenicereus (Cactaceae); (Replaced L.N. 36 of 2011. Amended L.N. 125 of 2023)

subsection.name: f
subsection.content: finished products of Aloe ferox and Euphorbia antisyphilitica packaged and ready for retail trade; and (Added L.N. 36 of 2011. Amended L.N. 22 of 2021; L.N. 125 of 2023)

subsection.name: g
subsection.leadIn: finished products that—

paragraph.content: contain parts and derivatives of Bletilla striata, Cycnoches cooperi, Gastrodia elata, Phalaenopsis amabilis or P. lobbii derived from artificial propagation; and
are packaged and ready for cosmetics retail trade. (Added L.N. 125 of 2023)

section.name: s0-4
section.content: Designates logs, sawn wood and veneer sheets.

section.name: s0-5
section.content: Designates logs, sawn wood, veneer sheets and plywood.

section.name: s0-6
section.content: Designates logs, woodchips, powder and extracts. (Amended L.N. 98 of 2014)

section.name: s0-7
section.content: Designates underground parts (i.e. roots, rhizomes): whole, parts and powdered.

section.name: s0-8
section.content: Designates all parts and derivatives except those bearing a label “Produced from Hoodia spp. material obtained through controlled harvesting and production under the terms of an agreement with the relevant CITES Management Authority of [Botswana under agreement No. BW/xxxxxx][Namibia under agreement No. NA/xxxxxx][South Africa under agreement No. ZA/xxxxxx]”. (Replaced L.N. 98 of 2014)

section.name: s0-9
section.content: Designates all parts, derivatives and finished products, except those that are, or are contained in, finished musical instruments, finished musical instrument parts, and finished musical instrument accessories, that are to be re-exported. (Amended L.N. 125 of 2023)

section.name: s0-10
section.content: Designates logs, sawn wood, veneer sheets, plywood, powder and extracts. Finished products containing those extracts as ingredients, including fragrances, are not covered by this annotation. (Amended L.N. 114 of 2018)

section.name: s0-11
section.content: Designates logs, sawn wood, veneer sheets, plywood and extracts. Finished products containing those extracts as ingredients, including fragrances, are not covered by this annotation. (Added L.N. 36 of 2011. Amended L.N. 98 of 2014)

section.name: s0-12
section.content: Designates kernel (also known as “endosperm”, “pulp” or “copra”) and derivatives of them, except those that are, or are contained in, finished products packaged and ready for retail trade. (Added L.N. 36 of 2011. Amended L.N. 98 of 2014; L.N. 125 of 2023)

section.name: s0-13
section.leadIn: Designates all parts and derivatives, except—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: seeds and pollen;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: seedling or tissue cultures obtained in vitro and transported in sterile containers; (Amended L.N. 125 of 2023)

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: fruits;

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: leaves;

subsection.name: e
subsection.content: exhausted agarwood powder, including compressed powder in all shapes; and

subsection.name: f
subsection.content: finished products packaged and ready for retail trade (excluding woodchips, beads, prayer beads and carvings). (Added L.N. 98 of 2014. Amended L.N. 114 of 2018)

section.name: s0-14
section.leadIn: Designates—

subsection.name: a
subsection.leadIn: for any species other than one referred to in paragraph (b) or (c)—all parts and derivatives, except—

paragraph.content: leaves, flowers, pollen, fruits and seeds; (Amended L.N. 22 of 2021)
finished products made partly or wholly of wood of the species, subject to an upper weight limit on wood of 10 kg per shipment; and (Replaced L.N. 22 of 2021. Amended L.N. 125 of 2023)
finished musical instruments, finished musical instrument parts and finished musical instrument accessories; (Added L.N. 22 of 2021)

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: for Dalbergia cochinchinensis—parts and derivatives covered by annotation #4; or

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: for Dalbergia spp. originating and exported from Mexico—parts and derivatives covered by annotation #6. (Added L.N. 114 of 2018)

section.name: s0-15
section.content: Designates seeds, fruits and oils. (Added L.N. 114 of 2018. Amended L.N. 22 of 2021)

section.name: s0-16
section.content: Designates logs, sawn wood, veneer sheets, plywood and transformed wood. (Added L.N. 22 of 2021)

section.name: s0-17
section.content: Designates eggs. (Added L.N. 22 of 2021)

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 7 of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an extract is a substance obtained directly from plant material by physical or chemical means regardless of the manufacturing process; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an extract may be in the form of solid (such as crystals, resin, fine particles and coarse particles), semi-solid (such as gums and waxes) or liquid (such as solutions, tinctures, oil and essential oils). (Added L.N. 98 of 2014)

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 7 of this Part, products, shipped singly or in bulk for final use or retail trade (purpose), are finished products packaged and ready for retail trade if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the products do not require any further processing for the purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the products are both packaged and labelled for the purpose; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the products are in a state fit for being sold to or used by the general public. (Added L.N. 98 of 2014)

section.name: s9A
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 7 of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cargo transported under the terms of 1 single bill of lading or air waybill (irrespective of the quantity or number of containers or packages included) is to be treated as 1 shipment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the things transported by an individual on entering or leaving Hong Kong (irrespective of whether the things are worn or carried by the individual or included in the individual’s personal baggage, and the quantity or number of the things worn, carried or included) are to be treated as 1 shipment. (Added L.N. 22 of 2021)

section.name: s9B
section.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (a)(ii) of annotation #15 in section 7 of this Part, the upper weight limit on wood of 10 kg per shipment is an upper limit of 10 kg imposed on the weight of wood of each individual species present in the items in the shipment. Accordingly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the limit is to be assessed against the individual weights of the portions of the wood contained in each item of the shipment, and not against the total weight of the shipment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the weights of the wood of different individual species are not to be added together for determining whether the limit is exceeded. (Added L.N. 125 of 2023)

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 7 of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a musical instrument (as referenced by Chapter 92 of the Harmonized System of the World Customs Organization (Musical instruments; parts and accessories of such articles)) that is ready to play or needs only the installation of parts to make it playable; and

paragraph.name: b
